instruction_text:
To fix Excel freezing issues:

1. Check file size and complexity:
   - Large files (>100MB) may cause freezing
   - Files with many formulas/links
   - Files with extensive formatting
   - Consider splitting large files

2. Check for problematic add-ins:
   - File > Options > Add-ins
   - Check 'COM Add-ins' > Go
   - Disable all add-ins
   - Restart Excel and test
   - Re-enable one by one to identify problem

3. Check for circular references:
   - Formulas > Error Checking > Circular References
   - Fix any circular references
   - These can cause Excel to freeze

4. Disable hardware acceleration:
   - File > Options > Advanced
   - Display section
   - Uncheck 'Disable hardware graphics acceleration'
   - Or check it if already unchecked (toggle)
   - Restart Excel

5. Check for external links:
   - Data > Edit Links
   - Check for broken or slow external links
   - Break links if not needed
   - Update links if broken

6. Clear Excel cache:
   - Close Excel
   - Delete: %AppData%\Microsoft\Excel
   - Delete Excel temp files: %Temp%\Excel*
   - Restart Excel

7. Check printer settings:
   - File > Print > Printer Properties
   - Change default printer
   - Some printer drivers cause Excel to freeze
   - Try printing to PDF instead

8. Update Excel:
   - File > Account > Update Options
   - Update Now
   - Install latest updates
   - Restart Excel

9. Check calculation mode:
   - Formulas > Calculation Options
   - Change from Automatic to Manual
   - Test if freezing stops
   - Revert if needed

10. Disable automatic calculations:
    - Options > Formulas
    - Uncheck 'Enable iterative calculation'
    - Reduce maximum iterations

11. Check for corrupted file:
    - Try opening file in Safe Mode: excel.exe /safe
    - Use Open and Repair: File > Open > Browse > Select file > Open dropdown > Open and Repair
    - Create new file and copy data

12. Check system resources:
    - Task Manager > Check CPU/Memory usage
    - Close other applications
    - Free up disk space
    - Add more RAM if needed

13. Check compatibility mode:
    - File > Options > Advanced
    - Display section
    - Uncheck 'Disable hardware graphics acceleration'
    - Try compatibility settings

14. Reset Excel settings:
    - Close Excel
    - Rename Excel registry key (advanced)
    - Or reset via Office Repair

15. Reinstall Office/Excel:
    - Control Panel > Programs > Uninstall
    - Choose Office > Change
    - Select Quick Repair or Online Repair
    - Restart if needed

16. Check for malware:
    - Run antivirus scan
    - Some malware can affect Office applications

17. Test with different file:
    - Create new blank workbook
    - Test if Excel freezes with new file
    - If new file works, issue is with specific file

18. Check Windows updates:
    - Install pending Windows updates
    - Updates may fix Excel compatibility issues
